((IPathEditorInput) input).getPath().toString());

The FileEditorInput implementation of getPath returns IResource.getLocation(), which can return null if the file is not in the local file system.

Sorry, this problem appears to be in the abstract editor infrastructure, rather than the text editor framework.
Fixed in build >20051129. John how did you manage to open this editor - I would like to test further with it.

Created an attachment (id=30813)
Example plugin

This plugin adds an "Expand Zip File" action to the context menu on IFile.  When you run this action on a zip file in your workspace, it will expand the zip file in the workspace tree by using a linked resource to a "zip" file system.  This zip file system is a good way to test with non-local resources.
John currently I get an error opening zip file dialog when I try this. Do you have a zip file this will work for?
